intro: Lecomtedoxa biraudii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, typically blooming during the warmer months. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Lecomtedoxa biraudii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
